medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had recurrent lower respiratory tract infections since early childhood. At age 17, he began experiencing recurring warts on his fingers. At age 20, he underwent splenectomy for unexplained thrombocytopenia and recovered fully. At age 26, he was admitted for treatment of bilateral frontal cerebral abscesses and subsequently developed grand mal seizures. Over the past 8 years, he experienced several episodes of bacterial pneumonia requiring hospital admissions, with pathogens including Haemophilus influenzae and Pseudomonas aeruginosa, and a CT scan showed severe bronchiectasis and pulmonary fibrosis. Lung function tests showed progressive deterioration despite treatment.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Spleen removed at age 20 due to thrombocytopenia; history of cerebral abscesses and grand mal seizures. No other relevant medical history specified.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents were healthy and heterozygous for the FCN3 mutation. Three siblings included one heterozygous, one with two wild-type alleles, and one living abroad.
